metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16745 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in mgetty before 1.2.1. In fax_notify_mail() infaxrec.c, the mail_to parameter is not sanitized. It could allow a bufferoverflow if long untrusted input can reach it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mgetty - 1.2.1-1
mgetty-fax - 1.2.1-1
mgetty-pvftools - 1.2.1-1
mgetty-viewfax - 1.2.1-1
mgetty-voice - 1.2.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mgetty package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-1').
